item.title: New Magic: The Gathering - Final Fantasy Cards Are Up for Preorder
item.content:encoded:
Here's some good news. Wizards of the Coast has announced that new Magic: The Gathering - Final Fantasy cards are heading our way, and they're available for preorder now (see them at Amazon). We have a new Chocobo Bundle, a new Commander Deck, and four new Scene Boxes. There's a lot to cover, so let's dive in.

New MTG: Final Fantasy Cards

All the new bundles and packs are in the carousel above, so scroll on over to the item(s) of your choice.

MTG: Final Fantasy - Chocobo Bundle

Magic: The Gathering - Final Fantasy Chocobo Bundle

Includes 1 Chocobo Booster, 10 Play Boosters, 1 Alt-Art Promo Card, 1 Scene Card, 32 Basic Lands, 1 Click Wheel, and more.

The Chocobo Bundle comes with 1 Chocobo Booster, 10 Play Boosters, 1 alt-art promo card, 1 Scene card, 32 basic lands, 1 click wheel, and more.

MTG: Final Fantasy VII - Commander Deck - Game Edition

Magic: The Gathering Final Fantasy VII Commander Deck - Game Edition

Includes Limit Break Commander Deck, Exclusive Promo Card, Final Fantasy VII Video Game Download Code, and Accessories.

The Game Edition Commander Deck is a Limit Break Commander Deck that includes an exclusive promo card, a Final Fantasy VII video game download code, and accessories.

MTG: Final Fantasy - Scene Box Bundle

Magic: The Gathering - Final Fantasy Scene Box Bundle - All 4 Scene Boxes

Includes Garland at The Chaos Shrine, Children of Fate, The Siege of Alexandria, and Camp Comrades Scene Boxes.

This bundle gets you all four Scene Boxes. That means you get Final Fantasy: Garland at The Chaos Shrine, Final Fantasy VIII: Children of Fate, Final Fantasy IX: The Siege of Alexandria, and Final Fantasy XV: Camp Comrades. Read on to buy them separately, or to see what comes in each one. Note that there's no discount for buying the bundle: $167.96 is exactly the same price you'd pay if you bought them all individually.

MTG: Final Fantasy - Scene Box - Garland at The Chaos Shrine

Magic: The Gathering - Final Fantasy Scene Box - Garland at The Chaos Shrine

Includes 6 Foil Borderless Scene Cards, 6 Art Cards, 3 Play Boosters + 1 Display Easel.

The Garland at the Chaos Shrine Scene Box is based on the original Final Fantasy game, which originally came out on NES in 1987. It comes with 6 Foil Borderless Scene Cards, 6 Art Cards, 3 Play Boosters, and 1 Display Easel.

MTG: Final Fantasy VIII - Scene Box - Children of Fate

Magic: The Gathering - Final Fantasy VIII Scene Box - Children of Fate

Includes 6 Foil Borderless Scene Cards, 6 Art Cards, 3 Play Boosters + 1 Display Easel.

The Children of Fate Scene Box is based on Final Fantasy VIII, which originally came out on PS1 in 1999. It comes with 6 Foil Borderless Scene Cards, 6 Art Cards, 3 Play Boosters and 1 Display Easel.

MTG: Final Fantasy IX - Scene Box - The Siege of Alexandria

Magic: The Gathering - Final Fantasy IX Scene Box - The Siege of Alexandria

Includes 6 Foil Borderless Scene Cards, 6 Art Cards, 3 Play Boosters + 1 Display Easel.

The Siege of Alexandria Scene Box is based on Final Fantasy IX, which came out on PS1 in 2000 (they used to really crank these games out, didn't they? It includes 6 Foil Borderless Scene Cards, 6 Art Cards, 3 Play Boosters and 1 Display Easel.

MTG: Final Fantasy XV - Scene Box - Camp Comrades

Magic: The Gathering - Final Fantasy XV Scene Box - Camp Comrades

Includes 6 Foil Borderless Scene Cards, 6 Art Cards, 3 Play Boosters + 1 Display Easel.

And finally, the Camp Comrades Scene Box is based on Final Fantasy XV, which came out in 2016. It includes 6 Foil Borderless Scene Cards, 6 Art Cards, 3 Play Boosters, and 1 Display Easel.

Chris Reed is a commerce editor and deals expert for IGN. He also runs IGN's board game and LEGO coverage. You can follow him on Bluesky.

Originally posted:

Sep 26, 2025 7:22 pm

item.title: The 10 Most Valuable Spider-Man MTG Cards That Collectors Are Already Chasing
item.content:encoded:
Marvelâ€™s Spider-Man set for Magic: The Gathering has finally swung into stores (after its recent prerelease), and the unique combination of comic book icons and fun new play designs is making it pretty popular so far.

So popular, in fact, that one rare card has already sold for $10,000, while others are also making a strong case for collectors themselves, tallying in the hundreds for market value. That's at least for now, as these values could still change wildly in the coming weeks.

Yet, suppose you were hoping to snag these rare cards without dropping a fortune, tough luck, as standalone prices on these bad boys likely won't change that much.

Collector Boosters were the only real shot to pick them up, and theyâ€™ve already vanished from shelves. The only ones left are with online resellers, who are asking over $1,000 for a box of just 12 packs.

So if youâ€™re opening packs this week (particularly if you were lucky and snagged some Collector Boosters before the rush), these are some of the priciest cards to look out for, courtesy of data from our friends at TCGPlayer.

10 - Gwenom, Remorseless (Extended Art)

Gwenom, Remorseless

Kicking off the list with a banger, Gwenom, Remorseless is a Venomized version of Gwen. Itâ€™s 4/4 with Deathtouch and lifelink, which lets you spend life to play extra cards from the top of your library.

Itâ€™s a neat idea, and one Iâ€™m curious to see players build around. The card is around $37 right now.

9 - Gwen Stacy/Ghost-Spider (Borderless)

Gwen Stacy/Ghost-Spider

Sticking with Gwen, but a much less spooky version, this borderless card shows our heroine relaxing before flipping into action against Electro.

Gwen Stacy/Ghost-Spider (Borderless) is around $40 for the nonfoil and double that for the foil.

8 - Miles Morales/Ultimate Spider-Man (Borderless)

Miles Morales/Ultimate Spider-Man

Another transforming Spidey card, this version of Miles Morales powers up other cards and then transforms into a camouflaging web-slinger with first strike and haste.

Heâ€™s sitting at around $40, but you can expect to pay $70 for the foil.

7 - The Soul Stone

The Soul Stone

Weâ€™ll see this card again very soon, but The Soul Stone is not only a piece of Marvel history - its card is exciting in its own right.

To play it, youâ€™ll exile a card in order to trigger its â€˜Harnessâ€™ ability, which essentially brings a creature card back from your Graveyard every turn. Itâ€™s going for around $85.

6 - Miles Morales/Ultimate Spider-Man (Borderless)

Miles Morales/Ultimate Spider-Man

This version of Miles Morales is the same as the prior one on this list in terms of play functionality, but it has an awesome reverse that looks like a comic book cover.

Itâ€™s pricier, too, currently fetching close to $150.

5 - Peter Parker/Amazing Spider-Man (Borderless)

Peter Parker/Amazing Spider-Man

He had to show up eventually, right? This card looks like the iconic moment Peter Parker gets bit by a spider on one side, and his first appearance alongside Marvelâ€™s Fantastic Four on the other.

Itâ€™s currently sitting at around $200, and could climb.

4 - Eddie Brock/Venom, Lethal Protector (Borderless)

Eddie Brock/Venom, Lethal Protector

This Eddie Brock/Venom, Lethal Protector card is another one with a comic-book cover on the flipside, and the iconic antihero is fetching a mean price at $200.

As for gameplay, Venom lets you sacrifice cards to draw and play other spells, potentially shifting your board state pretty quickly.

3 - The Soul Stone (Borderless)

The Soul Stone

Yes, thereâ€™s a less flashy version of The Soul Stone, but this Thanos artwork looks amazing. The Borderless version of the card is currently going for around $4,000 on TCGPlayer, but the site lists its market value as closer to $1,000.

2 - Spectacular Spider-Man (Various)

The Spectacular Spider-Man cards from this set were bound to be popular, both because the card is great and its artwork is awesome, but if you have a textured foil one, you might be in for a windfall.

There are five to get, starting at around $850 for the Future Foundation Suit and the Spider Armor MK 1 Suit, while The Black Suit variant can fetch around $950.

The Six-Armed Spider-Man suit is worth just over $1000, while the awesome Bombastic Bag-Man Suit card is already up to $1,250.

1 - The Soul Stone (Cosmic Foil)

The Soul Stone

This powerful card is up for big money in its borderless format as weâ€™ve covered already, but the Soul Stoneâ€™s Cosmic Foil variant is even harder to find. As I mentioned, one has reportedly already sold for $10,000, which just about buys a box of Collector Boosters these days.

Lloyd Coombes is an experienced freelancer in tech, gaming and fitness seen at Polygon, Eurogamer, Macworld, TechRadar and many more. He's a big fan of Magic: The Gathering and other collectible card games, much to his wife's dismay.
